title: Samir (footballer, born 1981)
text:
Samir Lima de Araújo (born October 25, 1981), known as just Samir, is a Brazilian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player who last played for <a href="Avispa%20Fukuoka">Avispa Fukuoka</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Tuiuti%2C%20S%C3%A3o%20Paulo">Tuiuti</a>. Samir began his playing career with <a href="Clube%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Bragantino">Bragantino</a>. He joined <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Vit%C3%B3ria">Vitória</a> in 2001, and made his <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">Campeonato Brasileiro Série A</a> debut for the club in 2002, scoring 2 goals in 12 matches.
In September 2004, Samir signed a contract with <a href="China%20League%20One">China League One</a> side <a href="Guangzhou%20Evergrande%20F.C.">Guangzhou Rizhiquan</a> from <a href="Sport%20Club%20Corinthians%20Paulista">Corinthians</a>, replacing <a href="Gary%20Glasgow">Gary Glasgow</a> who injured in the <a href="2006%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28CONCACAF%29">2006 FIFA World Cup qualification</a>. He made his League One debut on 6 September in a 2 - 1 home win against <a href="Zhejiang%20Greentown">Zhejiang Greentown</a>. Samir scored in his fourth match for Guangzhou which broke brance of the match in a 1 - 1 draw with <a href="Qingdao%20Hailifeng">Qingdao Hailifeng</a> on 22 September. He scored 3 goals in 16 appearances in the 2004 league season and moved to another League One club <a href="Jiangsu%20Sainty%20F.C.">Jiangsu Sainty</a> in 2005. He scored only 2 goals in the 2005 league season and was released by the club.
On 18 March 2007, Samir transferred to China League One club <a href="Beijing%20Hongdeng">Beijing Hongdeng</a>. He played as <a href="attacking%20midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> in the club and scored his first and only goal of the season on 11 August, in a 3 - 1 home victory against <a href="Harbin%20Yiteng">Harbin Yiteng</a>.
Samir moved to Japan and signed a contract with <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> side <a href="Avispa%20Fukuoka">Avispa Fukuoka</a> in March 2012 but was released after just one season having made only 9 league appearances.
